value.title: The COALESCE function in Power BI DAX
value.excerpt: In this vLog, we will talk about the COALESCE function in Power BI Dax. COALESCE function accepts multiple arguments and returns the first argument that is nonblank.  The SQL users are aware of this COALESCE function. We have the now DAX function equivalent of SQL COALESCE.   In this video, we will talk

value.title: 3 things to get up and running with KPIs in Reporting Services 2016 (CTP 3.3)

value.title: 4 steps to use a custom directory with Power BI for developers
value.excerpt: I look at how you can use your Azure Subscription to create a custom directory and then apply a Power BI (free) license to that. This is a great approach, if you are a developer, to setup an application within your directory for testing purposes before you publish to production.
